heading: millennial checkup
subheading: the jury’s still out on when the 20th century ends. 2000? 2001? some say it happened the day sinatra died. but author eurydice finds its ending in a mood of discovery. at once a voyeur, skeptic, and seeker, she reports on the national passion for those hardy american perennials – sex and personal growth – […]
author: michael e. ross
text: the jury's still out on when the 20th century ends. 2000? 2001? some say it happened the day sinatra died. but author eurydice finds its ending in a mood of discovery. at once a voyeur, skeptic, and seeker, she reports on the national passion for those hardy american perennials - sex and personal growth - with intelligence and humor. in satyricon usa, eurydice travels to 10 cities and creates a disturbing, edgy, erudite portrait of the nation's sexual mores at century's end. eurydice takes a "rite-of-passage road trip through america," interviewing housewives, students, bankers, and transvestites. she unearths a sexual america profoundly inventive, sadly repressed, but more normal than she envisioned. from observance of bloodletting rites in san francisco to her encounter with a cyberlover in memphis, she hears the thrum of passion in a range of shattering, surprising ways.satyricon usa: a journey across the new sexual frontier by eurydice: $22. scribner: +1 (212) 698 7000.street credcheap power towerthe world as interfaceo mighty layout-o-matik!t1 rextake the body!don't leave home without itpage after pagemillennial checkupcinema undergroundpocket serverthe games girls playmusicjust outta betareadmefind your typeyou've got junk mailcontributors
